polished_script:
HOOK: You're not failing because you picked the wrong strategy. [ON-SCREEN: "It's not your strategy..."]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: Garrett Maroon built a top 1% business in Southeast Virginia. And when struggling agents ask him what finally worked, his answer makes them mad. [ON-SCREEN: "TOP 1% AGENT"] Because you've tried everything, right? Cold calling for two months. Facebook ads for six weeks. Video content for a month. Door knocking until it felt awkward. Instagram reels until the algorithm changed. You keep switching strategies wondering why nothing sticks.
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's what Garrett told me that no one wants to hear.

INSIGHT: He said: "Pick a path and stay there long enough until it works." [ON-SCREEN: "PICK A PATH & STAY"] That's it. Not the perfect CRM. Not the hottest lead source. Not the newest AI tool. Just one strategy — relationships, door knocking, video, whatever — and the discipline to not jump ship when it feels hard at month three. [ON-SCREEN: "12 MONTHS NOT 12 WEEKS"] Because here's the truth: every strategy works if you give it twelve months. Almost no strategy works if you give it twelve weeks.

REFRAME: The top producers aren't smarter or more talented than you. They just stopped switching. [ON-SCREEN: "THEY STOPPED SWITCHING"] They picked their path and stayed long enough to master it. You can start this today — just pick one thing and commit.

CTA: "What's the one strategy you're committing to for the next twelve months?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: Stop switching strategies every few months. Top agents pick ONE path and stick with it for 12 months minimum. What's your path?

HASHTAGS: #RealEstate #RealtorTips #KeepingItReal #RealEstateAgent #TopProducer

SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "Every strategy works if you give it twelve months. Almost no strategy works if you give it twelve weeks."

PERFORMANCE_NOTES: 
1. HOOK delivery: Pause after "failing" for emphasis, slight lean forward on camera
2. INSIGHT section: Slow down on the 12 months vs 12 weeks contrast — let it land
3. CTA: Direct eye contact, genuine curiosity tone — like asking a friend, not selling
